page.title: 05Farming (cont)
page.content: {Education/Research { {Craibstone Institute} This institute, belonging to the North of Scotland College of Agriculture, was founded in 1904. It lies on the A96 Aberdeen/Inverurie/Inverness road 5 miles West of Aberdeen. The original farm has been extended over the years and now covers some 417 hectares(1070 acres) lying between 75 and 170 metres above sea level. there is a great deal of soil variation due to it being 'drift' of glacial origin overlying granite. As a result the land is generally second or third class by Aberdeenshire standards. Situated on the Estate are the College divisions of Zoology(Beekeeping), Engineering, Farm Buildings, Poultry Husbandry and Veterinary Investigation.
